newsitem.title: USA: NY extends Con Edison settlement talks.
newsitem.headline: NY extends Con Edison settlement talks.

text.p: The New York Public Service Commission said Tuesday the deadline for filing a settlement in Consolidated Edison Co of New York Inc's restructuring case has been extended two days to Thursday.
The commission issued a notice that also set schedules to be followed once the Con Edison and Central Hudson Gas & Electric Corp settlements are filed.

The notice also said specific schedules in the other three restructuring cases will be the subject of notices to be issued when it is better know whether or not there will be comprehensive settlements in the cases.

The commission previously extended the deadline for settlements in the three cases -- involving New York State Electric & Gas Corp, Orange and Rockland Utilities Inc, and Rochester Gas and Electric Corp -- to March 25.
Central Hudson's case schedule left its filing deadline remains unchanged for March 18, the date set on March 6.
"Assuming (the) proposed settlement agreements" in the Con Edison and Central Hudson cases are filed as planned, the commission said, its schedule calls for --
-- Prefilings in support of the settlement on March 25 and April 1, respectively;
-- Responses to proponents statements and statements otherwise opposing the settlement on April 9 and April 15, respectively; and
-- Rebuttal statements and prefiled testimony on April 18 and April 25, respectively.
The commission's schedule now calls for Con Edison evidentiary hearings on April 30 through May 5 and Central Hudson hearings on May 5 through May 8.
